intro: Coespeletia, commonly known as the Andean sunflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically have hairy stems and leaves, and they are adapted to high-altitude environments. Coespeletia species are often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cooler, drier conditions. They play an important role in the biodiversity of their native regions.
